Description: Small black-glazed pottery kantharos (Attic?); flaring lip, slightly thickened at rim, continuous with concave neck; convex body; flat-topped vertical handles with spurs, rising slightly above rim and tapering sharply; moulded foot with short concave upper member, convex lower member in two degrees; scraped or worn groove between the members; concave underside with central nipple; thin groove on resting surface. Wholly glazed, worn and fired brownish in places.
Curator's comments: Compare Sparkes and Talcott, Agora 12, pl. 29 nos. 709 and 710, pl. 29, dated 350 BC to 325 BC
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1252)
